How does Verus enable the launch of new blockchains and liquidity pools, and what features are available for crowdfunding and multi-chain interoperability?

Verus provides a range of features that enable the launch of new blockchains and liquidity pools, as well as crowdfunding and multi-chain interoperability. Here are some of the key ways in which Verus achieves this:

**Simultaneous Blockchain and Liquidity Pool Launches:**
Verus allows for the simultaneous launch of a new blockchain and a decentralized or centralized "bridge" converter liquidity pool. This bridge converter liquidity pool is part of the new blockchain's definition and runs on the new blockchain, with all fees generated being earned on the new blockchain. This means that there are no fees paid back to the Verus blockchain, and instead, the new blockchain has seamless connectivity.

**Blockchain-based Crowdfunding Currency Launches:**
Verus enables blockchain-based crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds. This means that users can set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in their preferred currencies on the chain. If the minimum levels are not met by the start time of the blockchain, all participants will automatically receive a refund of their pre-conversions, minus network fees.

**Launch Options:**
Verus provides a range of launch options, including maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price-neutral pre-allocations to select IDs, and price-neutral carve-outs of proceeds. Additionally, VerusIDs can be used to include vesting schedules in pre-allocations.

**Interoperable, Multichain Network:**
The Verus multi-currency, multi-chain network allows for the creation of an unlimited number of interoperable blockchains. Notary IDs, specified at chain definition, provide decentralized blockchain-specific bridge confirmation, enabling public blockchains available to the world for merge mining and staking. This enables unlimited scale and new use cases for blockchain technology.

Overall, Verus provides a robust set of features that enable the launch of new blockchains and liquidity pools, as well as crowdfunding and multi-chain interoperability.

## Simultaneous blockchain and blockchain liquidity pool launches
- Launch of a world class, worldwide, merge-mineable blockchain along with a fully decentralized or centralized “bridge” converter liquidity pool as part of defining a new blockchain. Bridge converter currencies have the same flexibility as other fractional 100% asset backed or partially asset backed currencies, but is bound to the launch of the new blockchain, runs on the new blockchain, and all fees generated via cross chain fee conversions or general use of the liquidity pool are earned on the new blockchain with no rent going back to the Verus blockchain, only seamless connectivity.
## Blockchain-based, crowdfunding currency launches with minimum participation or automatic refunds, including for dual launches (blockchain and bridge)
- Set required minimum levels of worldwide participation in your preferred currencies on chain. If by the start time of your blockchain, minimums are not met, all participants will automatically get a refund of all of their pre-conversions, less the network fees. The launch options also provide for maximum participation in one or more currencies, pre-launch discounts, price neutral pre-allocations to select IDs that increase the fractional reserve ratio to issue currencies, similarly price neutral carve-outs of proceeds, and pre-launch discounts for early participants. Using VerusIDs, launches can also include vesting schedules in the pre-allocations as well.
